title: ECLECTIC RESONANCE Legendaria
price: Pre-Order & Event Price: 12€ / 2000 yen | Post Release Price: 15€ / 2400 yen

01.title: The Wisp and the Willow Tree
description: • Composer: Philip Saguil (Resonant Union), Emma Kobin
• Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Philip Saguil
• Used VSTs & Samples: Ilya Efimov Nylon Guitar, SWAM Violin, SWAM Cello, Lo-Ki Soft Piano, LABS Music Box

• About this track: I wrote this track over two years ago for Emma. I never ended up releasing it, but when time came for Legendaria to close, I asked Emma if she would write lyrics and sing over it for the submission. She said yes, and turned the instrumental into a gorgeous song!
The flowers, the swords within you
But here alone beneath this tree
There's a storm in my eyes
I stay the same so you can change
In the center of the crowd when
I knew you'd find a way to stay
I looked up at the stars
I knew that they were ours
I knew that just as the sand
Your soul will break down their
Walls just to return home to me
In the woods, in the meadow,
I'll wait for you, as I have before

02.title: A Mysterious Prophecy
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Embertone - Joshua Bell Violin (solo violin); Spectrasonics - Trilian (synth bass); Roland JV-1080 + SRX Orchestra (all the rest)

• About this track: This track focuses on the softer and meditative side of old school JRPG music.  It is one of my belief that JRPGs soundtracks did a lot of good for classical music. The extent of the influence of classical music in those kind of music is non-negligible and, as a result, an extraordinary amount of JRPGs got symphonic arrangements albums and concerts. A lot of those concerts, despite being held in usually classical venues, are often sold-out. Most of the people attending are young and not the kind to be classical concertgoers. The main instruments of this track are the violin and piano, two staples of western classical music, whether it is in chamber music or pieces written for large ensembles. The other instruments and sounds are almost all from an old rompler featured prominently in 90's RPGs, with most of these aforementioned RPGs seeing symphonic arrangements later down the line.

03.title: Adventure of a Day
description: • Piano, Whistle & Soprano Saxophone: Justin Thornburgh (Resonant Union)
• Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Justin Thornburgh (Resonant Union)
• Used VSTs & Samples: Spitfire Chamber Strings, Spitfire Studio Brass, EW Hollywood Orchestral Percussion

• About this track: Celebrating the day-to-day, this track paints the possibilities of the adventure that is living each day with joy and passion. Inspired by the slice of live genre and the Atelier soundtracks.

04.title: Blossom Magic
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Tamari (Welkin Strider)
• Used VSTs & Samples: Celtic Era 2, Indian Bells
• About this track: The travelers are resting at the side of a river. They enjoy listening to a singing bird and feel the breeze. With her spell, the girl blooms flowers around them.

05.title: Grasslands
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Orange Tree Samples - Evolution Steel Strings (guitar); Musical Sampling - Hoard Fingerstyle (guitar); Impact Soundworks - Pearl Concert Grand (piano); Best Service - Celtic ERA 2 (tin whistle); Strezov Sampling - Balkan Ethnic Orchestra (choir); Native Instruments - Kontakt Factory Library (celesta); Spitfire Audio - Spitfire Chamber Strings (strings ensemble); Loops de la Crème - Clap Pack Deluxe 2 (hand claps); GForce Software - M-Tron Pro IV (mellotron flutes); Spectrasonics - Trilian (fretless bass)

• About this track: This is a track heavily inspired by world music seen through the lens of various JRPGs such as the Suikoden or Atelier series. The title itself is a reference to a track from Chrono Cross often known as "The Grasslands of Time: Home World", and the influence of Yasunori Mitsuda is overall quite obvious. Other than that, I also took inspiration from various folk music, especially Spanish ones. The harmonies and melodies also shows some influences from a Japanese band named Choro Club, who themselves are primarily influenced by diverse folk music. Those are all pretty natural influences and inspirations of mine, so this track is kind of a candid love letter to them.
Key: Eb dorian (0:00~0:37) - Bb dorian (0:37~0:56) - Bb major (0:56~1:15) - Eb dorian (1:15~1:34); it then loop over so the same keys / modulations applies

07.title: Du Rififi dans la Ville Fleurie
description: • Acoustic Guitar, Bass Guitar, Flute, Melodica, Djembe, Salt Shaker, Tambourine, Bongos, Claps: Tee-vee
• Used VSTs & Samples: Kontakt 7, NI Sessions Strings Pro 2, Korg Triton Extreme, Korg M1, Korg MonoPoly, Arturia B-3V, Arturia Mellotron V, NI Mallet Flux, NI Noire

• About this track: Experimented a whole bunch with my acoustic instruments for this one, also particularly happy with the "chorus" melody considering how fast it came to be. Can you tell I'm still very new to flute. The section around 2:15 is the rififi part, the rest is Ville Fleurie
Key: C major/G Mixolydian, B minor (choruses)

title.en: The Bird That Soars Through Time and Space

description: • Cello, Octave Mandolin & Electric Tenor Guitar by asuton
• Used VSTs & Samples: MODO BASS,  KONTAKT
• About this track: The beginning of a new story (a game's opening). An exciting adventures in which we travel around the world. [これから始まる物語の序章（ゲームのオープニング）世界中を旅するワクワクした冒険。]

09.title: The land where they once were
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Cororo
• About this track: I named this song after an imaginary story in which the people who protected this land are gone for some reason, and we think of them through relics and the like.

10.title: Pensive The Evening Star
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Yumi Sakata
• Used VSTs & Samples: Kontakt: Noire, Cinewinds, The Conservatoire Collection, Balkans Ethnic Orchestra

11.title: Feu Follet
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Pianoteq, Opus, Orchestral, Easydrummer, Halione

• About this track: This track mixes several musical influences, such as fairly traditional RPG music, Celtic music and rock with the main influence of the band Muse. I tried to do something dynamic with nuances, but also something mysterious with dark parts.

12.title: Aeromancer
description: This track emerged when burnout was slowly encroaching. Earlier in the year, I had decided I would commit to Legendaria, feeling confident in my orchestration abilities after dabbling in fantasy music on two separate occasions. But the timing ended up being poor - my workload was the largest and most intimidating it'd ever been, events in my life had tested my will to press forward with music as a whole, and I was a little anxious about submitting to an album where I knew I'd be standing amongst giants. It seemed like everything around me was telling me "no", and so I got paralyzed by Legendaria, the task looking more and more daunting. My solution was brute force - powering through the turmoil because I figured I'd be better off for it. This track, "Aeromancer", is the result. The composition is soaring and triumphant, which I'm unsure how I pulled off amidst so much negativity. Jazz flavors are peppered in at various points, lending a slight chaos that the bright chorus section resolves beautifully. In arranging this song, I was reminded that this task should be one of joy and love for the craft, and it was easy to run with from there. While my circumstances will not improve immediately, I can always, without fail, forget my troubles with music, and "Aeromancer" is the proof of that.

13.title: Distant Village
description: • About this track: This is an old track which I made for a university project! It was made to be a demo track for JRPG-style town themes based on some research I was doing at the time.

14.title: Faeries in the Coral Abyss
description: • Composer & Arranger: Shauno Isomura [磯村翔之]
• Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Shauno Isomura [磯村翔之]
• Additional Mastering: EQ, Glue compression, Multiband compression, Stereo expansion, Limiting to restore loudness

• About this track: This is the song of ancient forest that is cold, mysterious, yet beautiful like the deep sea. The two main objectives of this piece was to give an impression of underwater using land/forest instruments, and to make it easy to listen to while being difficult to fully understand on a first listen. To get this "ancient" feeling, I decided to make use of traditional Japanese music elements such as Haraikotoba, Gagaku/Netori and hinting the sound of Shō and Uchimono using western instruments.

15.title: Library of Prayers
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Elliot Hsu (Azure Archives)
• Used VSTs & Samples: Kontakt (for 99% of the instruments), Ample Guitar M,

• About this track: Dark corridors of ancient books, enticing those who stumble upon it to venture further. A blinding light shines when the forbidden tome is read, as the pages search for the one who's chosen.

16.title: Echoes of the Night
description: • Programmed & Mixed by dystopian tanuki, SpiralFlip
• About this track: Depicting a character following a familiar voice through a forest.

17.title: Bravery Quest
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Fukagawa
• Additional Mastering: Stereo expansion, multiband compression
• About this track: In this song, I put a focus on courage, exploration and development. I made this song so that the listeners can vividly imagine a fantasy world.

18.title: The Last Everlasting World
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by WujuBlade
• Additional Mastering: Multiband compression, clipper to regain loudness
• Used VSTs & Samples: Kontakt 7, Audiolatry Grand Piano, BBC Symphony, 3x OSC, Serum (Primary VSTs USED)

• About this track: The Mountain stands in silence, the wind no longer speaks. The Ocean lost its touch, what lies ahead opens. Yet in this final moment, where everything is dim. May our heart still burn bright, In the Everlasting world, Chase towards the endless light. The Last everlasting world will shine for everyone.

19.title: Liluth
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Virharmonic Bohemian Violin, Eduardo Taritontes Accordion
A family heirloom of long history
caught the king's eye in a banquet
Soon it was stolen and detained
That is the beginning of war between races
A tremendous power in the wrong hands
With the help of Gaia's guidance
I shall end this once and for all
Blessed with the knowledge of ancestry
Hear the chants of Mother Gaia
A single pendant that leads to reset
Even when both kin and foe become lost
I'll become (I'd still be) the catalyst  for a greater cause
Thus, years passed by with a flourishing new world
長い歴史を持つ家宝が
宴会で王の目に留まった
すぐに盗まれ、拘 留された
それは人種間の戦争の始まりだ
強大な力は間違った手に渡れば
森林と世界を危険にさらす
ガイアの導きの助けを借りて
これを永遠に終わらせる
祖先の知識に恵まれた
リルースは失われた教えを復活だ
母なるガイアの歌声を聞く
リセットにつながるペンダント
壊滅大惨事を引き起こす
すべて生き物を消滅さ
たとえ親族も敵も消え去った
しても(全部、全部 消えてた
大きな目的のきっかけと(私
こうして、年月が経った、新
